task_summary: The robot is instructed to reach a towel situated on the workspace, performing visual perception, approach, and alignment steps as seen in 9 contact sheet frames.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robot arm positioned in front of a towel on a table. The task is to visually locate the towel, move the end effector above the towel at a safe height, then approach and align precisely towards the towel. No grasping, manipulation, or transport occursâ€”the aim is to reach and be poised above the towel. The sequence is visually evident in the frames.
preconditions: Robot is powered on and at a safe home/ready position
Towel is present and unoccluded on the workspace
No foreign obstacles block the planned path
stepwise_plan: Check if the towel is visible
Move above the towel with a safe vertical offset
Approach and align to be directly over towel
success_criteria: Robot's end effector is above and aligned with the towel
Towel is within the field of view/or perceivable
No collisions or unexpected contacts occur
failure_and_recovery: If towel is not visible: trigger DetectObject action
If collision or misalignment: abort and notify operator
task_long_description.termination: Sequence completes once the robot is above and aligned with the towel.

frame_3.now_evidence: end effector directly above target area; approach is nearly complete
frame_3.predicts_next: final adjustments for alignment or fine positioning

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is currently visible to the perception system.
Attempts to locate the towel using sensors within an 800ms timeout if not visible.
Moves the end effector to a position 5cm above the towel, with a 1500ms timeout.
Performs a fine approach and alignment over the towel, with tight 0.005 tolerance and a 1500ms timeout.

failure_modes: Path obstructed or collision detected during move
Alignment fails due to perception error
recovery_strategy: Retry detection if towel is not visible
Abort and notify if persistent obstruction or misalignment
assumptions: Instruction did not specify grasp or manipulation; observed frames suggest only approach.
Exact towel position assumed available via perception; no explicit pose estimation indicated.

expected_success_criteria: End effector stops aligned above towel with no collision
